title: Tom Yellow Horn
description:
DOD: November 5, 1978, age 76.

Son of Yellow Horn. He was an active leader of the Brave Dog Society. He farmed & ranched on the Peigan Reserve until he retired in 1973.

title: Mrs. Laura Buffalo (nee Annie Crow Round) Iikanistanopata – All Listens Woman
description:
She was a very prominent member of Piikani Nation because she was older, people looked up to her and she was involved in ceremony.

Her children were: Jack Crow Shoe [minor head chief], Ethel Yellow Horn, Joe Crow Shoe, Richard Crow Shoe, Arthur Crow Shoe, Elsie Crow Shoe, Margaret Plain Eagle.

title: North Axe
description:
Head chief of the North Peigan People (apatohsipiikani), circa 1886. He succeeded his father, Sitting-On-Eagle-TailFeathers.

According to the Brocket Liber Animarum he is Butcher’s brother. North Axe died on March 22, 1890.

title: Mrs. Man Who Smokes
description:
Aged 77, as of January 1957. Wearing headdress of the Sundance Bundle (Winter Count., pg. 61). “Black Bear Woman, born 1881, her first husband was Little Moustache (DOD December 12, 1927), They had 13 children together.

Second husband was Neil Yellow Wings (DOD January 26, 1936), they married January 19, 1928.

Third husband was Sam Man Who Smokes (DOD January 28, 1940), they married on July 5, 1936.

title: Albert Yellow Horn Sikapioohkitopi- Grey Horse Rider
description:
November 10, 1915- June 4, 1993, age 77.

His parents were Head Chief Tom Yellow Horn and his mother Maggie Grassy Water. His brother Chief John Yellow Horn, Tom Yellow Horn, Joe Yellow Horn, Philip Yellow Horn. One sister Missy Crow Shoe, Half-sister Nellie Potts (nee Yellow Horn).

Albert was a researcher for the Peigan Band, some of his success include the 1977 Weir Blockade, which resulted in ongoing revenue for the Peigan Band. The 1909 land surrender claim. This court decision resulted in a 4-million-dollar cash settlement for the Peigan Band.

Albert was an avid sportsman, he competed in Rodeos, boxing, wrestling and fastball. In his personal life he was a Rancher, a Farmer, a Logger, and Politician.

title: Crow Eagle
description: Chief of the North Peigan People, circa 1895.

title: Blackfoot Chiefs
description: L-R: Sitting on a Eagle Tail (apatohsipiikani), Three Bulls might be Bullhead (Blackfoot), Crowfoot (Siksika), Red Crow (Blood Tribe).

title: John Yellow Horn (Sinopotakan – Fox Head)
description:
Born: 1900- Died: June 22, 1983, age 82.

Hereditary Chief Son of Yellow Horn. John’s first wife was Ethel Crow Shoe, together they had 5 children (Andrew, Ida, Albert, Andrew, Eva, Thomas, Peter and his stepdaughter Ethel Small Legs).

John’s second wife was Elsie Crow Shoe, together they had Joanne, Velma, Charlie, Sonny, Pauline, Gladys and Roy, stepchildren: Shirley, Walter, Robert.

He resided in Brocket all his life, he is noted as being the last lifetime elected Chief, retiring in 1962.

title: Chief Phillip Big Swan & Chief Crow Eagle
description: Date: August 1926 Glenbow Archives Image #: NA-4133-8 Remarks: In the original size photograph, Chief Yellow Horn is on the left side of Philip Big Swan. This photo was taken at the Peigan Sundance.

title: Joe Crow Shoe
description:
He was an Anglican lay-person until he made his way back to Piikani Culture in the 70’s. In 1977, they had the first Sundance in Piikani since the 1940s. He was the one of the main people to bring it back; others involved were Brave Dog Society.

He used to be the holder of the “Short Thunder Medicine Pipe”, initially the pipe was Jack Crow Shoes. The original pipe holder was Mrs. Laura Buffalo.
